Probably a dumb question, but here 'goes...

Have you tried focusing on Kerbin in these situations? It might force a re-display of the patched conics.

Hmm

I use precise node to boost conic limit. You can do the same with a configuration edit.

Are you running any mods?

If you quit to the space center and then switch back to your craft via the tracking station, do the patched conics reappear?

Have you tried focusing on Kerbin in these situations?

I focused different targets, tried "Control from here" too, but nothing changed.

If you quit to the space center and then switch back to your craft via the tracking station, do the patched conics reappear?

Yes!

I'm using mods of course, who doesn't. I think I noticed such a behaviour without any mods in the past, but I can't be sure.

Two possibilities I can think of:

#1: You haven't upgraded the Tracking Center; a level 2 tracking center is necessary for patched conics.

#2: If you are using a Kopernicus-based mod, you might actually be exiting to solar orbit if the Mun is very close to the edge of Kerbin's SOI. I'm pretty sure it's happened before when a modder forgot to update Kerbin's SOI.
cant be number one because he has patched conncis on the exit of the SOI. I am going to guess mod related

Of course it's not a problem of building upgrade.

And I can now confirm this bug(?) happens without any mod!

To be sure, I just did a fresh install (redownloaded official Win32 1.0.4). I created a new game, built a dumb Apollo like rocket (oops, forgot the legs on the lander).

I feel it has something to do with rendez-vous/docking maneuvers/control transfer, that's why I detailed my mission in the first post. Because it never happened with simple ships with no lander.

The craft file: http://grrroux.free.fr/divers/apollo_bug.craft
